{{infobox comedian | image= Loni Love 140 Twitter Conference 2009.jpg | caption= Love at the 2009 [[Twitter|Twitter Conference]] | birth_date= {{birth date and age|1971|7|12}} | birth_place= [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]], U.S. | residence= [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], [[USA]] | active= 2003–present | name= Loni Love | birth_name= | other_names= | spouse= | domestic_partner= | website = {{url|http://www.lonilove.com/}} | medium= {{hlist|Comedian|television host|actress}} | nationality= American | genre= [[Observational comedy]] | subject= {{hlist|Relationships|current events|American politics{{cite web|url=http://www.417mag.com/Blogs/417-Blog/March-2010/417-at-417-An-Interview-with-Comedian-Loni-Love/ |title=417 at 4:17: An Interview with Comedian Loni Love - 417 Blog — March 2010 - Southwest Missouri |publisher=417mag.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-31}}}} | influences= {{hlist|[[Richard Pryor]]|[[Bill Maher]]|[[Joan Rivers]]|[[Eddie Griffin]]}} | influenced= }} '''Loni Love''' (born July 12, 1971) is an American comedian, actress and author. While working as an electrical [[engineer]] in 2003, Love began to pursue a career in music engineering. She was the runner-up on ''[[Star Search]]'' 2003 and was named among the "Top 10 Comics to Watch" in both ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' and [[Comedy Central]] in 2009. She is currently one of the hosts of ''[[The Real (TV series)|The Real]]'' talk show along with [[Jeannie Mai]], [[Tamera Mowry]], and [[Adrienne Bailon]], which premiered on July 15, 2013.{{cite web|title=It's Official: ‘The Real’ Talk Show Begins Four-Week Test Run July 15|url=http://www.deadline.com/2013/06/real-talk-show-july-15-premiere-test-run-fox/|work=Deadline Hollywood|accessdate=28 July 2013|date=June 12, 2013}} ==Life and career== Love was born in [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]], and grew up in the [[Brewster-Douglass Housing Projects]].{{cite web|url=http://www.lonilove.com/about|title=About|publisher=|accessdate=13 March 2017}} Prior to her career as a comedian, she was an electrical engineer,{{citation|title=Lonie Love: Laughter For Life|url=http://www.singersroom.com/lifestyle/feature-story-157.asp|first=Njai|last=Joszor|date=27 August 2009|accessdate=2009-11-13|publisher=Singersroom.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090831090838/http://singersroom.com/lifestyle/feature-story-157.asp|archivedate=31 August 2009|df=}} an experience she talks about in many of her acts.{{citation|title=Loni Love Foxy (And Funny) Problem Solver|url=http://www.realdetroitweekly.com/content/article_5851.shtml|first=Emma|last=Richardson|date=3 November 2009|accessdate=2009-11-13|publisher=[[Real Detroit Weekly]]}}{{dead link|date=May 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} After graduating from high school in 1989, she had worked for a time on the [[General Motors]] assembly line putting doors on 1993 [[Oldsmobile Cutlass]]es, work which ignited her interest in electrical engineering. Love then received her bachelor's degree in electrical engineering from [[Prairie View A&M University]] in [[Texas]]. While at Prairie View, she minored in music and was also a member of the Eta Beta Chapter of [[Delta Sigma Theta]].{{cite web|last=Carnes |first=Jim |url=http://www.sacbee.com/2010/07/30/2921692/loni-love-will-say-whats-on-her.html |title=Loni Love will say what's on her mind at Punch Line — Sacramento Entertainment — Sacramento Movie Theaters, Music | Sacramento Bee |publisher=Sacbee.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-31}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/LoniLove/status/14409286401 |title=Twitter / Loni Love: Eta Beta Chapter for life |publisher=Twitter.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-31}} It was there that she discovered stand-up comedy after winning a $50 competition and then performed frequently during her college life. After finding work as an engineer at [[Xerox]] in California, she continued to do stand-up after work in clubs and became a regular at the [[Laugh Factory]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thetowerlight.com/2010/09/riding-the-love-train/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-10-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110131075010/http://www.thetowerlight.com/2010/09/riding-the-love-train/ |archivedate=2011-01-31 |df= }} After eight years of working at Xerox, Love resigned to pursue comedy during a layoff to prevent someone else from losing their job. Recently Love did a show on VH1 called I Love the 2000s which she gives her view on 2000-2009's pop culture highlights and became a Roundtable panelist for her friend and fellow comic [[Chelsea Handler]]. Love started her comedic career in 2004, after appearing on ''Star Search'', reaching the finals and losing in a close competition to the winner.{{citation|url=http://www.cbs.com/primetime/star_search/comedian/020603.shtml|title=Loni Love & John Roy|accessdate=2009-11-16|publisher=[[CBS|CBS Broadcasting Inc.]]}} Since then, she has appeared in films and numerous television shows. She has also acted in dramatic theatre plays. Love was named "Hot Comic" for 2009 in ''Campus Activity'' magazine and one of the "Top 10 Comics to Watch" in both ''Variety'' and Comedy Central. She was awarded the Jury Prize for best stand-up at the 2003 [[US Comedy Arts Festival]]. In 2008 Love became the [[CNN]] correspondent for ''[[D. L. Hughley Breaks the News]]'' and covered the inauguration of President [[Barack Obama]]. She also appears regularly in comedy clubs and the college comedy circuit. In late 2009, Love recorded her first one-hour Comedy Central special, ''America's Sister'', which aired on May 8, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.the-trades.com/article.php?id=11822 |title=Interview: Loni Love: American Sister |publisher=The Trades |date=2010-04-20 |accessdate=2010-08-31}} In 2013, Loni released her first comedy advice book titled "Love Him Or Leave Him But Don't Get Stuck With The Tab". It was published by Simon and Schuster. In 2015, she appeared in the comedy film ''[[Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2]]'', with Kevin James, and the action film ''[[Bad Asses on the Bayou]]'', with Danny Trejo and Danny Glover.{{cite web|url=http://blackamericaweb.com/2014/04/09/loni-love-lands-a-new-role-in-paul-blart-mall-cop-2%e2%80%b2/|title=Loni Love Lands A New Role In ‘Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2′!|date=9 April 2014|publisher=}} The same year, Love was reported as developing a remake of the dating game show ''[[Love Connection]]'', with herself as the host.{{citation|title=Get Ready For A New 'Love Connection'|date=2015-01-22|url=http://www.tvnewscheck.com/article/82444/get-ready-for-a-new-love-connection|accessdate=2015-01-22}} However, it fell through at the last minute. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" ! colspan="4" style="background: LightSteelBlue;" | Film{{citation|url=http://www.lonilove.com/pages/bio.html|title=Resume|accessdate=2009-11-16|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091126060821/http://www.lonilove.com/pages/bio.html|archivedate=2009-11-26|df=}} |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !
